Title: Python setattr()
Description:
Python's setattr() function is useful for setting properties on objects when you don't specifically know the property names. For instance, to map arbitrary keys from a dict onto an object, you could do this:

class TestObj(object):
    pass

t = TestObj()

d = {'one':1, 'two':2}

for k,v in d.items():
    setattr(t, k, v)

Whereas trying to do the last part like this:

for k,v in d.items():
    t[k] = v

Would result in the following error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<input>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: 'TestObj' object does not support item assignment
